item.title: Oscars 2019: Felix Film’s take on the Winners, the Losers, and yearly scheduled general disappointment
item.author: Mikhail Demtchenko,Sung Soo Moon,
item.description: Best Picture Academy Prediction: Probably Green Book or The Favourite What we want to win: I’d want to see Roma win, personally; maybe it might? BlacKkKlansman probably would win if this were ten years ago. Anything except A Star is Born. The nominees for Best Picture are arguably the most diverse …

item.title: Memory Loss, Chopping off fingers, and Erotic musical numbers: A Perfect Valentine Trio
item.author: Aidan Chan,Sung Soo Moon,Mikhail Demtchenko,
item.description: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind Tis the season of romance! Whether you’re looking for a film for your next night in with your significant other, or to drown the bitter feeling of rejection, Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind is surely the answer. It’s a film that’s suitable for all couples, …

item.title: It’s a Wonderful Felix Film Christmas: The Lowdown of Must Watch Christmas Films this Holiday Season
item.author: Mikhail Demtchenko,Aidan Chan,Sung Soo Moon,
item.description: The Nightmare Before Christmas Less of a nightmare, more of a dream for a Christmas movie choice Sick of the Jingle Bells and the Christmas lights? Tired of fake white beards and elven tights? Well you are in luck my mates, for The Nightmare Before Christmas awaits. From the inexplicable mind of Tim …

item.title: LISFF: A Celebration of the Possibilities of Short Film
item.author: Mikhail Demtchenko,
item.description: After two years of sold-out screenings, premieres, and dozens of excellent short films, LISFF is delighted to return to Kino Bermondsey for a third year. LISFF 2018 will run December 9th – 12th, showcasing new talent, and filmmakers of independent spirit making creative and innovative use of low …

item.title: Russian Film Week returns to London in November!
item.author: Mikhail Demtchenko,
item.description: The third Annual Russian Film Week will be held on November 25 to December 2, 2018 in landmark venues across London: BFI Southbank, Regent Street Cinema, Curzon Mayfair, Empire IMAX Leicester Square as well as in Edinburgh, Cambridge and Oxford. The eight-day festival celebrates the best of new …

item.title: Felix Film’s guide to the Oscars – who will win, who should win, and who’ve been left out in the cold

item.description: Oscars season is upon as! And, as is traditional, Felix are here to give you a rundown of what will win on the night, as well as what should win, and who didn’t even get a nomination: Best Picture It’s been a complicated awards season. item.title: Stretching your student loan: cinema on a budget
item.author: Mikhail Demtchenko,
item.description: 5. Picturehouse Cinema – £5 Matinee; £7 Weekdays When you think of cinema chains, you think of overpriced popcorn at Odeon, or £15 tickets at Vue, but Picturehouses breaks the mold. Located in some of the most archi-tecturally unique buildings in London, Picturehouses spreads from the Ritzy Theatre …
